sentence.text: Patient 7 was the second child of a non-consanguineous Brazilian couple.
She was noted at birth to have dysmorphic features with a “median nasal groove and crumpled ears” [Cabral de Almeida et al., 1995].
Cataracts were diagnosed at 3 months of age.
She had delayed eruption of her primary dentition and pointed cusp tip extension.
Her weight and height were consistently below the 3rd centile.
Radiographs showed epiphyseal delay and lumbar coronal clefts.
At age 5 years, she was described as having mild intellectual impairment.
